definitions.definition: The lowest rate at which an employer can legally pay an employee; usually expressed as pay per hour.
A witness stand in a courtroom.
A manufacturer and vendor of drugs and medicines.
definitions.example: For sale by all druggists

definitions.definition: A piece of cloth designed to be worn around the waist.
A decorative length of cloth worn over the shoulder to the opposite hip, often for ceremonial or other formal occasions.
To adorn with a sash.
The opening part (casement) of a window usually containing the glass panes, hinged to the jamb, or sliding up and down as in a sash window.
A draggable vertical or horizontal bar used to adjust the relative sizes of two adjacent windows.
In a sawmill, the rectangular frame in which the saw is strained and by which it is carried up and down with a reciprocating motion; the gate.
To furnish with a sash.
Bringing or warranting disgrace; shameful.
Giving offense to moral sensibilities and injurious to reputation.
A dying star of low or medium mass, more solid and dense but less bright than the sun.
Particles of matter that cannot be detected by their radiation but whose presence is inferred from gravitational effects.
By restriction, particles that have mass, which does not readily interact with normal matter except through gravitational effects.
Of or pertaining to one's father, his genes, his relatives, or his side of a family
definitions.example: paternal grandfather

definitions.definition: Fatherly; behaving as or characteristic of a father.
Received or inherited from one's father.
Acting as a father
definitions.example: paternal filicide

definitions.definition: An elongated hill or ridge of glacial drift.
The lower jaw, especially the lower jawbone.
One of a pair of mouthparts of an arthropod, designed for holding and cutting food.
A barbecue (apparatus for grilling).
A barbecue (event: cookout).
A barbiturate.
A kind of sports shoe that extends significantly over the wearer's ankle.
One who or that which inhibits.
definitions.example: I found daily meditation to be a useful inhibitor of negative thoughts.

definitions.definition: Any substance capable of stopping or slowing a specific chemical reaction.
Any substance capable of stopping or slowing a specific biological process
A person involved in armed conflict against an occupation, or oppressive government, etc.; a revolutionary, an insurgent, a rebel or insurrectionist.
A government in which sovereignty is embodied within a single, today usually hereditary head of state (whether as a figurehead or as a powerful ruler).
The territory ruled over by a monarch; a kingdom.

A form of government where sovereignty is embodied by a single ruler in a state and his high aristocracy representing their separate divided lands within the state and their low aristocracy representing their separate divided fiefs.
States based on a system of governance headed by a king or a queen.
(of hair, clothing, jewellery, or similar) Reaching the shoulders.
definitions.example: With her shoulder-length platinum blonde hair, she was easy to spot from afar.

definitions.definition: A soft toy in the form of an animal.
An animal that has undergone taxidermy.
The nominal height of the surface of the oceans above which heights of geographical features and aircraft flight levels are measured.
To distort or collapse under physical pressure; especially, of a slender structure in compression.
To make bend; to cause to become distorted.
To give in; to react suddenly or adversely to stress or pressure (of a person).
definitions.example: It is amazing that he has never buckled after so many years of doing such urgent work.

definitions.definition: To yield; to give way; to cease opposing.
To enter upon some labour or contest; to join in close fight; to contend.
To buckle down; to apply oneself.
A clasp used for fastening two things together, such as the ends of a belt, or for retaining the end of a strap.
The brisure of an eighth daughter.
(roofing) An upward, elongated displacement of a roof membrane frequently occurring over insulation or deck joints. A buckle may be an indication of movement with the roof assembly.
A distortion, bulge, bend, or kink, as in a saw blade or a plate of sheet metal.
A curl of hair, especially a kind of crisp curl formerly worn; also, the state of being curled.
A contorted expression, as of the face.
To fasten using a buckle.
To unite in marriage.
The state of being a girl.
The childhood of a girl.
Certain edible sea snails, especially, any one of numerous species of large marine gastropods belonging to Buccinidae, much used as food in Europe.
Pimple
A stripe or mark; a ridge; a wale.
A streetcar moved by gripping to rotating loop of cable running along the track.
A hanging carriage or car for transporting people or cargo
To make solemn, or official, through ceremony or legal act.
definitions.example: The couple chose to solemnize their relationship in a secular ceremony, instead of having a wedding.

definitions.definition: To make grave, serious, and reverential.
The act of marginalizing or something marginalized.
A large white puffy cloud that develops through convection. On a hot, humid day, they can form towers and even become cumulonimbus clouds.
A mound or heap.
To deprive of nerve, force, or strength; to weaken; to enfeeble.
definitions.example: to unnerve the arm

definitions.definition: To make somebody nervous, upset, alarm, shake the resolve of.
definitions.example: I was greatly unnerved by the news that my attacker was back in the country.

definitions.definition: A subtropical plant.
Pertaining to the regions of the Earth further from the equator than the tropical regions.
A place or room where something is dispensed.
An architectural design element involving water, such as a fountain, a pond or a waterfall.
Inadequately fed.
To feed inadequately or insufficiently

A romantic novel, usually in a historical setting, with frank depictions of sexual activity, especially one in which the female protagonist is seduced; (by extension) a film, television programme, etc., featuring such activity.
definitions.example: My aunt would bring a stack of torrid bodice rippers with her to the beach, and would unfailingly blush if disturbed in her reading.

definitions.definition: Confidence in one's own worth; self-respect.
A semi-formal jacket.
A person or thing that blazes (marks or cuts a route).
Anything that blazes or glows, as with heat or flame.
The dish used when cooking directly over the flame of a chafing-dish lamp, or the coals of a brazier.
One who smokes cannabis; a stoner.
One who spreads news, or blazes matters abroad.
An older member of a sporting club, often with old-fashioned or conservative views.
A con or swindle.
An instance of flip-flopping, of repeatedly changing one's stated opinion about a matter.

A bistable; an electronic switching circuit that has either two stable states (switching between them in response to a trigger) or a stable and an unstable state (switching from one to the other and back again in response to a trigger), and which is thereby capable of serving as one bit of memory.
A sandal consisting of a rubber sole fastened to the foot by a rubber thong fitting between the toes and around the sides of the foot.
definitions.example: 2004: the necessity for yet another place at which to buy a polo shirt or a pair of flip-flops may not be apparent to the town's residents — The New Yorker, 30 August 2004, p.38

definitions.definition: A change of places; an inversion or swap.
The sound of a regular footfall.
To alternate back and forth between directly opposite opinions, ideas, or decisions.
A local custom or law of a settlement or district.
A rule made by a local authority to regulate its own affairs.
A law or rule governing the internal affairs of an organization (e.g., corporation or business).
The mountain lion or cougar, Puma concolor.
A woman in her 20s or 30s who seeks relationships with younger men; a younger cougar.
To provide explanation.
To count.
The development and use of a system for recording and analyzing the financial transactions and financial status of an individual or a business.
A relaying of events; justification of actions.
definitions.example: He was required to give a thorough accounting of his time.

definitions.definition: An equitable remedy requiring wrongfully obtained profits to be distributed to those who deserve them.
Of or relating to accounting.
definitions.example: General accepted accounting principles

definitions.definition: A series of columns at regular intervals.
A peristyle.
A portico or stoa.
A regular row of anything, such as trees.
A shindig.
An uproar or disturbance; a spree; a row; a riot.
Hockey; shinney
A fancy or liking.
An invertebrate animal of the phylum Arthropoda, characterized by a chitinous exoskeleton and multiple jointed appendages
The release of a product or service, particularly software, to a limited audience in order to gain data on the product’s usage and acceptance by customers.
The launch of a missile in such a way that the rocket motor ignites outside of the launch tube, ejecting the missile non-explosively.
Not having been thrashed or beaten
Not defeated
definitions.example: Arsenal went 25 games unbeaten.

definitions.definition: Untrodden
definitions.example: We walked across unbeaten grassland.

definitions.definition: Not beaten or whisked
definitions.example: Fold in the unbeaten eggs.

definitions.definition: Not out
definitions.example: He scored an unbeaten century.

definitions.definition: Closest blood relative, heir to inheritance.
definitions.example: Lord Bentley has passed away; notify the next of kin.

definitions.definition: Close friend, spouse, or partner (for example on hospital admission form), one of someone's close ones.
A person skilled at carpentry, the trade of cutting and joining timber in order to construct buildings or other structures.

A senior rating in ships responsible for all the woodwork onboard; in the days of sail, a warrant officer responsible for the hull, masts, spars and boats of a ship, and whose responsibility was to sound the well to see if the ship was making water.
A two-wheeled carriage.
A carpenter bee.
A woodlouse.
To work as a carpenter, cutting and joining timber.
The armistice agreement signed between the Allies and Germany on 11 November 1918 to end World War I; (by extension) the end of World War I.
A (short) cessation of combat; a ceasefire, a truce.
A formal agreement, especially between nations, to end combat.
The divide between land and a body of water.
The line on a map that illustrates this.
Any of several American wild cherry trees, especially Prunus virginiana.
The fruit of this plant.
A young plant grown from seed.
Any young plant, especially:
Of, pertaining to, or having tuberculosis.
Relating to or reminiscent of the wheezing sounds associated with the breathing of tuberculosis patients.
Tuberculate.
Lacking in courage or confidence.
definitions.example: John's a very timid person. I'll doubt he'll be brave enough to face his brother.

definitions.definition: The grapheme of character ~.
The character used to represent negation, usually ~ or ¬.
A banknote with a value of five units of currency.
definitions.example: Do you have a fiver I could borrow? I can pay you back tomorrow.

definitions.definition: (by extension) The value in money that this represents.
definitions.example: I bought the chocolates; they were only a fiver.

definitions.definition: A clenched fist.
A mathematical puzzle played on a 5 × 5 grid.
A Zaydi Shiite Muslim, who disagrees with the majority of Shiites on the identity of the Fifth Imam.
A person who gives five percent of their income or five hours a week of their time to charity (a reduction of ten percent tithing).
An actor who provides voices or voice-overs for radio drama, animations, commercials, dubbed films, games, etc.
To make every possible effort in order to achieve something.
To take upon oneself; to start, to embark on (a specific task etc.).
To commit oneself (to an obligation, activity etc.).
definitions.example: He undertook to exercise more in future.

definitions.definition: To overtake on the wrong side.
definitions.example: I hate people who try and undertake on the motorway.

definitions.definition: To pledge; to assert, assure; to dare say.
To take by trickery; to trap, to seize upon.
To assume, as a character; to take on.
To engage with; to attack, take on in a fight.
To have knowledge of; to hear.
To have or take charge of.
The business of an undertaker, or the management of funerals
A promise or pledge; a guarantee
That which is undertaken; any business, work, or project which a person engages in, or attempts to perform; an enterprise
The act of one who undertakes (in either sense)
Without restrictions on holds or what opponents may do.
definitions.example: a no holds barred match

definitions.definition: Having absolutely no limits or restrictions as far as the levels and nature of one's hostilities and offense; taking to an especially ruthless or vicious manner.
definitions.example: a no holds barred debating style that quickly transformed into bickering

definitions.definition: A disagreement, parting of ways.
definitions.example: We had a fall out, couldn't come to terms and haven't talked since.

definitions.definition: To come out of something by falling.
definitions.example: I opened the cupboard and a can fell out onto my foot.

definitions.definition: To cease to be on friendly terms.
definitions.example: Dave and I fell out after a long argument.

definitions.definition: To leave one's place in the current formation of ranks in order to take one's place in a new formation.
To leave one's current location to report for duty at a new location.
definitions.example: The company fell out for an artillery drill.

definitions.definition: To pass out.
To turn out, happen.
A deputy to a president, often empowered to assume the position of president on his death or absence.
An executive in a business in charge of a department or branch.
A type of music and dance that originated in the West Indies (perhaps Trinidad), characterized by improvised lyrics on topical or broadly humorous subjects, often creating satire of current events.
To perform calypso.
A bulbous bog orchid of the genus Calypso, Calypso bulbosa
A light blue color.
An avocado-based greenish dip with onions, tomato, and spices. Common to Mexican cuisine, it is often served with tortilla chips.
Families that have been wealthy for generations or members of such families.
The monetary system used in the United Kingdom and Ireland before decimalisation in 1971 and consisting of pounds, shillings, pence and farthings.
The imperial system of measurement, as opposed to the metric system.
definitions.example: These scales say I weigh 72 kilograms; what's that in old money?

definitions.definition: Showing cowardice; lacking in courage; weakly fearful.
In the manner of a coward, cowardlily.
A polypeptide hormone that regulates carbohydrate metabolism.
Vulnerable, especially to abuse or delinquency
definitions.example: The actual at-risk population was limited to those directly exposed and could be quarantined or monitored.

definitions.definition: A cut of meat including the rib bones.
A rectangular closed box in which the body of a dead person is placed for burial.
The eighth Lenormand card.
A basket.
A casing or crust, or a mold, of pastry, as for a pie.
A conical paper bag, used by grocers.
The hollow crust or hoof of a horse's foot, below the coronet, in which is the coffin bone.
A storage container for nuclear waste.
To place in a coffin.
A biennial plant, Pastinaca sativa, related to the carrot.
The root of the parsnip, when used as a vegetable.
A beetle of the species Scarabaeus sacer, sacred to the ancient Egyptians.
Any species of beetle belonging to the family Scarabaeidae.
A symbol, seal, amulet, or gem fashioned to resemble the sacred beetle.
The feeding relationships between species in a biotic community.
A hierarchy.
Willing to consider new and different ideas or opinions.
To provide with gearing; to fit with gears in order to achieve a desired gear ratio.
To be in, or come into, gear.
To dress; to put gear on; to harness.
(usually with to or toward(s)) To design or devise (something) so as to be suitable (for a particular type of person or a particular purpose).
definitions.example: They have geared the hotel mainly at tourists.

definitions.definition: To borrow money in order to invest it in assets.
(often in combination) Fitted with (some kind or number of) gears.
Connected with a motor by gearing.
